title: Excellent experience
body:
We took the culinary food tour guided by Povan.
What a great experience!
Great local food, but above all great background stories related to the Malay people with their unique backgrounds.
Well recommended
Thank you Povan.

title: Really good food tour & more!!
body: What a fantastic food (& more!) experience with Siddoz! He took us around the ‘old centre’ tasting many different local specialities… we were full at the end of the tour & totally satisfied !! Not only did we taste & eat, Siddoz also gave us a guided tour of the area (unexpected) answering any questions we had regarding KL in a professional and lovely, relaxed manner. Big man Siddoz :) is a qualified guide so you can’t go wrong here! Highly recommended if you have a free 2-3 hrs in KL and like food!

title: Exceptional Foof Tour!
body: Hands down the best food tour that we have ever been on! We read many great reviews about our guide, Siddoz, here on Trip Advisor. We wanted to also rave about our experience. Siddoz curated an excellent selection of tastings. Each dish was wonderful and got us excited about the next stop. Siddoz's extensive knowledge of the melting pot of cultures and cuisines found in Kuala Lumpur was icing on the cake.

title: Fantastic selection of traditional foods
body: Great variety of food, top tour, fantastic way to see the traditional foods of Malaysia. Recommended foodie tour for any age, thanks to our knowledgeable guide 😊.

title: Great Tour
body: Our tour guide was really friendly and learned a-lot.  Will go again when going back here in Malaysia with my family or friends.

title: Great experience!
body: Farris was great, and took us all around the market. Super knowledgeable about the food, would highly recommend.

title: Great food tour
body: Informative guide, excellent chance to visit and try local cuisine, much of which we wouldn’t ordinarily try. Would definitely recommend

title: Real local flavor of food & culture!
body:
Highly recommended tour especially if Siddoz is guiding.
This isnt about food tasting only, which was amazing btw! Its about the ample time given to explain the culture, stories of important streets, the real flavor of ‘local culture’
Siddoz is highly intellectual person which really added a special flavour to whatever dishes we tried.
My family was so thankful! Siddoz you are the best!

title: Nice but Overpriced
body: It is a nice 2 hours (not 3 hours) walk in China town. Although we paid for 2 people, we were given one portion to share in each place and we had to even cut small deserts by two to try it (I think it was a good saving on us). We went to Indian place, then tried noodles in the market, then tried bacon, 2 fruits and soya desert. On the way, we were also offered an ice cream (was supposed to be shared again with my 15 yo son, but I asked to have two separate). Overall, I think the trip is interesting but overpriced for what it offers, I had to eat when I was back home.

title: Great tour!
body: We had a great time at the Foodtour. Very social, reliable and knowledgeable guide. Both children and adults were very satisfied. We highly recommend the trip.

title: Really great food with a knowledgeable guide
body:
We took this tour right after landing in Kuala Lumpur. Unfortunately our flight came in at 7:15am and our hotel check in was at 2pm. Even after immigration, customs, breakfast and the long ride from the airport to KL Sentral we still had a good 4 hours to go before check in. So, we booked this tour to help us pass the time.

The only thing visitors should know and the only suggestion I have is that Kuala Lumpur's Central market is quite a massive building and it can be hard to locate your meeting point. After calling our guide, Siddoz it was decided to meet up at the information desk, which is an easy to locate landmark within the Central market. I would suggest that the information desk meeting point should be specified in the ticket.

Other than that though, everything went well. Malay, Indian and Chinese Street food are all located very close to each other near the Central market area and depending on your tastes you can specify what you would like to try and the guide will adjust your tour accordingly.

Our guide, Siddoz knew both the locals and the foods very well and each dish was peppered with tales of the culture and the history from which it originated as well as the context in which different cultures arrived in Malaysia.

In terms of food, i would definitely recommend the curry laksa, nasi lemak and pork buns.

Lastly, if you have food allergies or religious prohibitions from trying certain foods, just remember to inform your guide at the beginning and they will accommodate accordingly.

We booked the tour because we had some time to kill but consider how good our experience was, I would recommend this tour to anyone who comes to KL.

title: Excellent introduction to Malaysia and especially the Chinatown area ... go on an empty stomach!!!
body: Our guide was Siddoz, the owner who gave us a great introduction to the city and it's cultural mix and history and of course the food. It's a gentle walk around Chinatown and little India sampling various cuisines with good explanations and you have the chance to really fill your stomach with loveliness. A fantastic way  to pass a few hours with a lovely local.

title: History/culture through food
body: I enjoyed this tour alot. It was a great introduction to Malaysia through food. I highly recommend it.

title: Fantastic experience.
body:
Fantastic experience. This was exactly what I was looking for. Povan took me to 10 restaurants to try different types of food. It was just not food. It was history, science behind the food and the history of Malaysia.

Absolutely worth the money! Thanks Povan!

title: Great way to try some authentic food - Malyasia has a melting pot of cuisines
body: Nice experincce with a walking tour with Zack. We live in Australia where Asian food is part of our regular diet. It was nice to experience the real food rathet then the westernised flavours we receive at home. Would reccomend

title: Great tour
body: Definitely do it at dinner time. Great experiences around town and a lot of great food. We would have never tried some of these places without our guide, who was super friendly and knowledgeable.

title: Great guide and amazing local food
body: My friend and I did this food tour yesterday evening with Ferris. It was just the 2 of us on the tour so we got some really great tips and info. The food was amazing and we did some shopping in Chinatown which was fun. I would highly recommend this tour to any visitors to KL.

title: Fabulous experience!
body: May is a friendly and approachable woman who gave us a fabulous experience. We had wandered through the same areas the day before but didn’t have the knowledge or confidence to sample the local food. However, with May, the experience was totally different. May’s expertise and enthusiasm were infectious. I would recommend a very light breakfast and then arrange to meet May around 11 am. She will guide you through the back lanes of Chinatown offering a variety of food which was all delicious. A tour not be missed.

title: A great way to sample local foods.
body: This tour is a must do experience, not only were the food and drink tastings superb there was also a good variety of different tastings to try. Povan also had a wealth of local knowledge that cannot be learnt from a guide book. A highly enjoyable tour.

title: Food tour in KL excellent
body: My guide was wonderful. He was a retired chef that gave me a lot of knowledge about food in KL.  I really enjoyed the experience.

title: Excellent experience
body:
We took the culinary food tour guided by Povan.
What a great experience!
Great local food, but above all great background stories related to the Malay people with their unique backgrounds.
Well recommended
Thank you Povan.
